Sentencas: An A-site deficient perovskite with metallic Ni in exsolution, Ni-Sr0.9Mo0.9O3-delta, has been prepared, characterized and tested as an anode material in intermediate-temperature solid-oxide fuel cells (IT-SOFCs).
Titulo: Defective Sr0.9Mo0.9O3-δ perovskites with exsolved Ni nanoparticles as high-performance composite anodes for solid-oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: It was obtained by reduction of a Ni-containing scheelite oxide, from which Ni is segregated to the surface as metal nanoparticles with average size of 30-35 nm, as demonstrated by high-resolution transmission electron microscopy (HR-TEM).
Titulo: Defective Sr0.9Mo0.9O3-δ perovskites with exsolved Ni nanoparticles as high-performance composite anodes for solid-oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: An in situ neutron powder diffraction (NPD) study of the Sr0.9Mo0.9O3-delta matrix shows an oxygen deficient cubic perovskite, defined in the Pm3m space group; no crystalline transitions were detected in the tested temperature range up to 850 degrees C. Morphological observations using a scanning electron microscope (SEM) and pore size determinations by Hg porosimetry showed a highly porous material with macropores.
Titulo: Defective Sr0.9Mo0.9O3-δ perovskites with exsolved Ni nanoparticles as high-performance composite anodes for solid-oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The electrical conductivity gave a maximum value of 215 S cm(-1) at 850 degrees C. A suitable thermal expansion coefficient, with values close to that of the electrolyte, showed no abrupt changes in its slope.
Titulo: Defective Sr0.9Mo0.9O3-δ perovskites with exsolved Ni nanoparticles as high-performance composite anodes for solid-oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Polarization curves and electrochemical impedance spectra (EIS) under open circuit were investigated.
Titulo: Defective Sr0.9Mo0.9O3-δ perovskites with exsolved Ni nanoparticles as high-performance composite anodes for solid-oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In single-cell tests, the materials generated outstanding output powers close to 1025 mW cm(-2) at 850 degrees C using pure H-2 as fuel.
Titulo: Defective Sr0.9Mo0.9O3-δ perovskites with exsolved Ni nanoparticles as high-performance composite anodes for solid-oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: All these features make this novel A-deficient perovskite with exsolved Ni particles a perfect candidate as anode material in intermediate-temperature SOFCs (IT-SOFCs).
Titulo: Defective Sr0.9Mo0.9O3-δ perovskites with exsolved Ni nanoparticles as high-performance composite anodes for solid-oxide fuel cells
